basics.name: Alex Alexandrescu
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer & Engineering Leader
basics.summary: Full-stack engineer and technical leader with 14+ years building web applications, leading distributed teams, and scaling startups. Deep expertise in TypeScript, Next.js, and React ecosystems. Founded and operated a software development agency specializing in Web3 technologies. Currently focused on AI-augmented development workflows, modern frontend architecture, and developer experience tooling. Author of '10 Years of Remote Work' (in progress). Open source contributor with a philosophy of extracting and sharing reusable solutions.

work.name: Conversy
work.summary: Voice biometric analysis startup using ML for speaker identification and speech content analysis. Transitioned from agency client to full-time consultant after Technically Correct wound down.
highlights: Architected client-facing interface using Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS
Built LangGraph-based template engine processing transcriptions through dependency-aware question templates with recursion for automated report generation
Designed software architecture ensuring subsystem independence and separation of concerns
Achieved 90% daily deployment success rate (PRs merged to main and deployed)

work.name: Technically Correct
work.summary: Founded software development agency specializing in Web3 and modern web technologies. Built team, acquired clients, delivered projects. Closed operations after Web3 market collapse in late 2022 made the specialized focus economically unviable.
highlights: Established agency delivering full-stack solutions for startups and scale-ups
Built team of 4 internal engineers and 20 contractors
Delivered 5 projects to production including RCKT, FANtium, and Conversy engagements
Key clients included RCKT (Berlin agency), FANtium (sports tech), and Conversy (ML/voice)
Invested in Web3 technology stack positioning; pivoted strategy when market conditions changed
Made difficult but responsible decision to wind down operations preserving client relationships

work.name: RCKT
work.summary: Contract engagement through Technically Correct. Berlin-based agency project rebuilding oetker.com corporate presence.
highlights: Rebuilt oetker.com corporate web presence using Next.js and Tailwind CSS
Collaborated with design team to implement modern, responsive design system
Established coding standards, automated testing frameworks, and CI/CD processes
Delivered high-quality user experience on successful launch

work.name: FANtium
work.summary: Sports technology startup. Hybrid technical and product role. Continued support engagement post-Technically Correct shutdown.
highlights: Integrated third-party payment providers and translated business requirements to technical specs
Bridged engineering and product teams on feature prioritization
Managed technical roadmap, sprint planning, and quarterly delivery cycles

work.name: Marley Spoon
work.summary: Meal kit delivery company. Led frontend architecture migration and team modernization.
highlights: Led team of 8 developers and deployment specialists in frontend architecture migration
Refactored legacy PHP ordering system to Next.js with TypeScript
Implemented full CI/CD pipeline with automated testing and compliance validation
Containerized frontend infrastructure using Kubernetes on AWS
Established GitHub Actions workflows improving code quality and deployment reliability

work.name: MVP Match
work.summary: Berlin-based technical talent marketplace. Early team member shaping company direction and technical processes.
highlights: Built technical recruitment and validation pipeline processing 310+ freelance profiles
Achieved 65% client acceptance rate on vetted technical candidates
Created domain expert program scaling technical vetting using network professionals
Provided technical advisory to clients in finance, health, and e-commerce
Worked closely with founders shaping company vision and processes

work.name: ADAMOS
work.summary: Darmstadt-based IIoT company providing digital solutions for manufacturing. Managed UI development for the ADAMOS ecosystem.
highlights: Led team of 7 on greenfield IoT research and connection platform
Built corporate identity, API contracts, and plugin marketplace from scratch
Managed prototyping team defining UI direction for industrial IoT platform
Leveraged JavaScript, Node.js, and React for web application development
Company pivoted before launch; delivered foundational architecture

work.name: MVP Factory
work.summary: Software development consultancy. Managed technical delivery across multiple client projects.
highlights: Managed technical delivery for multiple concurrent client projects
Developed staff augmentation pipeline including recruitment and mentorship
Collaborated with Business Development on proposals and new client acquisition
Served as technical counterpart to account and product owners

work.name: MVP Factory
work.summary: Built and scaled distributed JavaScript development teams. Advanced frontend architecture capabilities.
highlights: Scaled development teams building distributed senior JavaScript developer network
Transformed client requirements into technically feasible solutions
Conducted code reviews maintaining quality across all projects
Devised solutions for challenging, evolving feature requirements

work.name: Stefanini EMEA
work.summary: Global IT services company. Led JavaScript development across diverse client projects from legacy maintenance to Angular 2 applications.
highlights: Led JavaScript development across outsourcing engagements
Delivered projects ranging from legacy HTML to modern Angular 2 clients
Adapted to diverse client environments and technical ideologies

work.name: Talkbe
work.summary: Startup for content distribution across messaging platforms. Built analytics dashboard.
highlights: Built analytics dashboard from Angular 2 Beta through Release Candidate
Served as main frontend developer on 3-person team
Designed secure, navigable interface for campaign analytics

work.name: Teads Studio (formerly Brainient)
work.summary: Ad tech company. Developed interactive video ads and rich media solutions.
highlights: Developed interactive video ads using JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3
Built mobile games using JavaScript and canvas for ITV campaigns (Dominos, John Lewis)
Contributed to Angular 2 drag-and-drop rich media ad creation platform
Optimized video ads for performance across platforms adhering to IAB standards

work.name: eMAG
work.summary: Romania's largest online retailer. Maintenance and campaign development on Symfony 2 platform.
highlights: Maintained customized Symfony 2 e-commerce platform
Developed custom campaigns and newsletters

work.name: KUBIS Interactive
work.summary: Major Romanian digital agency. Full-stack development across diverse client projects.

Developed one of Romania's most visited Facebook game contest campaigns
Contributed to Vodafone.ro redesign for major cell provider
Worked with Laravel, CodeIgniter, WordPress, MySQL, MongoDB, AWS EC2

work.name: Stefanini Infinit (Infinit Agency)
work.summary: Digital agency. Flash-based ads, banners, websites, games, and apps.
highlights: Built augmented reality mobile app with Adobe Air
Developed Flash mini-game integrating Xbox Kinect SDK
Maintained internal development environments and R&D

work.name: SIVECO Romania
work.summary: Educational software company. Created interactive learning materials.
highlights: Transformed traditional educational materials into interactive experiences
Built knowledge validation platform with quizzes and teacher reporting

volunteer.summary: Collaborate with individual rescuers, veterinarians, and sanctuaries on cat rescue and adoption operations.
highlights: Transport cats between foster homes, veterinary clinics, and adoption events
Foster and socialize cats preparing them for adoption
Consult with potential adopters on cat selection and care
Coordinate with veterinary professionals on medical care

skills.name: AI & Developer Tools
practicalApplications: Home automation via habit tracking (geofencing + app logs)

projects.name: Calico
projects.description: Lightweight, zero-dependency structured data conversion library stack. Born from repeated client requests for data export — chose structured data and markdown over PDF/DOCX for open format flexibility.
highlights: @alexcatdad/calico — core conversion library
@alexcatdad/calico-cli — command line interface
@alexcatdad/calico-validators — validation utilities
Under 10KB non-gzipped, zero dependencies (compliance requirement)

projects.name: prisma-dto-generator
projects.description: Generates DTOs for class-validator/class-transformer from Prisma schemas. Enhanced for Prisma 7 output changes.
highlights: Automatic DTO generation from Prisma schema
class-validator/class-transformer compatible
Prisma 7 support with bespoke enhancements

projects.name: Meowtern
projects.description: React component library providing terminal-style UI for web applications. Inverse concept of Ink (React for CLI) — bringing CLI aesthetics to the browser.
highlights: Modern React with TypeScript
Terminal emulation components
Live demo available
Open source, designed for general use

projects.name: Open Source Philosophy
projects.description: Extract and publish reusable, non-proprietary solutions from client projects.
highlights: Libraries extracted from production codebases
Homelab tooling and automation
Developer experience utilities

coverLetterHooks.remoteExpert: Spent the last decade working remotely across time zones, currently documenting that experience in a book.
coverLetterHooks.agencyToProduct: Built and operated a development agency before returning to product work — I understand both sides of the client relationship.
coverLetterHooks.opensourcePhilosophy: I extract and open-source every reusable solution that isn't client IP.
coverLetterHooks.handsonLeader: I still write code daily, even in leadership roles.
coverLetterHooks.aiTransition: Actively integrating AI into development workflows — from Claude Code to semantic search tooling.

keyAchievements: Founded and operated software development agency (2021-2022)
Led frontend architecture migrations at Marley Spoon using Next.js and Kubernetes
Built technical validation pipeline at MVP Match scaling freelance talent vetting
Rebuilt oetker.com corporate presence with RCKT
Managed distributed teams across 5+ time zones
